name: chicagotribune
text: Chicagoans can do their part to help repair damage in their neighborhoods by joining cleanup efforts, making donations, supporting businesses and reporting vandalism to those organizing cleanup efforts. Here's how: https://t.co/uPwMPFYVuq

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago Public Schools will resume its “grab and go” free meal pickups on Tuesday following a one-day suspension attributed to unrest in the city. https://t.co/ZCrSxfYtgC

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @MorGreene: Cars honking, crowd cheering, protesters heading on to LSD https://t.co/Vo2DPYYDGY

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @erin_hegarty: Naperville Mayor Steve Chirico issues curfew of 9 p.m. tonight and a state of emergency. https://t.co/nzOOGR8htg

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @mandophotos: Protesters making there way to Lake Shore Drive https://t.co/cSsunLCjk5

name: chicagotribune
text: Peaceful protests. Looted storefronts. A wave of arrests. Chicagoans on Monday were left to grapple with the fallout of a chaotic weekend and pick up the pieces. https://t.co/eDNR98dl4Q

name: chicagotribune
text: George Floyd’s death at the hands of police in Minneapolis catalyzed days of protests in Chicago. But activists say the demonstrations here are rooted in anger over decades of abuse of African Americans by the city’s officers.  https://t.co/OUYNbu7g7f

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @dhinkel: Here’s my story giving some context to the complaints of local activists protesting the mistreatment of African-Americans by Chicago police. They’re angry about George Floyd, but also Rekia Boyd, Paul O’Neal and others. https://t.co/LGkhHrhOix

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @srfreish: Protesters are still marching around downtown Naperville. There doesn’t appear to be any effort to disperse the cro… https://t.co/mjmYv2WN1J

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago police and city leaders defended the handling of protests and looting amid criticism — including from some aldermen — that officers didn't do enough to quell unrest. https://t.co/159BjHRS6B

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @erinhooley: While photographing inside El Patron liquor in #Cicero, 2 men who were hiding in the back storeroom jumped out in front of me and walked with their hands up to be arrested by police. One man had a handgun on his person.  #GeorgeFloyd #ChicagoProtests #ChicagoRiots @chicagotribune https://t.co/av55Mku37QWhile photographing inside El Patron liquor in #Cicero, 2 men who were hiding in the back storeroom jumped out in f… https://t.co/gQAhdFNCWv

name: chicagotribune
text:
After Gene & Georgetti restaurant took a hit from looters, its owners said she understands why "there is anger right now."

"We can repair our damage. We know that there’s a much larger discussion that should be happening and needs to be happening." https://t.co/u3fiAS7lO9

name: chicagotribune
text: Appearing on CNN, Gov. Pritzker condemned President Trump's response to nationwide protests, calling him "a miserable failure." https://t.co/1t7tLo1bUe

name: chicagotribune
text: "I am outraged." The bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington criticized President Trump for staging a visit to a historic church after authorities cleared the area of peaceful protesters. https://t.co/ayeTkI6YCt

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @LAURA_N_ROD: Some of the men guarding the streets of Pilsen tonight say they’re not harassing innocent Black ppl. “We are just targeting ppl that are looting,” one said. “Looting comes in all colors...color doesn’t exist anymore, safety is the color.” https://t.co/kv7v7jF1gXSome of the men guarding the streets of Pilsen tonight say they’re not harassing innocent Black ppl. “We are just t… https://t.co/qRGTatAydG

name: chicagotribune
text: Metra will be out of service for a second day on Tuesday, while the CTA and Pace both imposed multiple service cutbacks and a second overnight shutdown. https://t.co/h3fK78pQTM

name: chicagotribune
text: Minutes before President Trump spoke on Monday, police and National Guard soldiers began aggressively forcing back hundreds of peaceful protesters who had gathered in Lafayette Park, across the street from the White House. https://t.co/Und41ZnE3D

name: chicagotribune
text: The demonstrations in Chicago are rooted in anger over decades of abuse of African Americans by the city’s police officers, activists said. https://t.co/AOx1PuCYyA

name: chicagotribune
text:
Good morning, Chicago. Here are some top stories to start your day:
-Widespread looting overshadows peaceful protests across Chicago
-Pritzker battles Trump on the national stage
-Familiar faces coming to WGN America's "unbiased" newscast
https://t.co/myP7pYjTuG

name: chicagotribune
text: Every marijuana dispensary in Chicago is closed indefinitely to prevent or clean up from looting and vandalizing. https://t.co/d8SLKiz8H3

name: chicagotribune
text: People shattered windows and looted multiple businesses in downtown Naperville Monday night. https://t.co/kx8nz64o10

name: chicagotribune
text: CTA buses and trains are running, but access to downtown Chicago remains restricted. You'll find the latest developments today from the fallout over the death of George Floyd here: https://t.co/kFCy4CMq8d

name: chicagotribune
text: "We can repair our damage. We know that there’s a much larger discussion that should be happening and needs to be happening in the area ... and want to be part of that discussion..." said one of the owners of River North steakhouse Gene & Georgetti. https://t.co/tTnqMb4IQB

name: chicagotribune
text: Cicero officials blamed "outside agitators" after two people were shot dead and 60 people were arrested in disturbances on Monday night. https://t.co/txbByOwMXL

name: chicagotribune
text: White Sox shortstop Tim Anderson didn't participate in protests over the police killing of George Floyd but took photos to share on Instagram “to show exactly what’s going on in the world, whether it’s good, bad or ugly.” https://t.co/ECXE4CGR0k

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago Public Schools will resume its “grab and go” free meal pickups today following a one-day suspension due to unrest in the city https://t.co/OiRYSOKlF3

name: chicagotribune
text: Correction: There are 9 states voting today, not 7

name: chicagotribune
text: Joe Biden slammed President Trump for directing authorities to drive back peaceful protesters outside the White House “in order to stage a photo op.” https://t.co/jShDbgQwK8

name: chicagotribune
text: Despite widespread looting and heightened public health concerns, Chicago will move ahead with looser coronavirus restrictions as planned on Wednesday. https://t.co/HwWB0LnybZ
